An early British fusion band, Atlantic Bridge put out a self-titled instrumental album in 1970. The skills of the players were impressive, and they didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t compromise their jazz roots, with Jim PhilipÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s saxes and flute showing a decided John Coltrane influence. Chief arranger Mike McNaughtÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s electric keyboard provided the most rock-oriented flavour. Daryl Runswick also creates some interesting passages with bowed bass.
